description: Routine check — O2 sensor reading intermittent. Recalibrated and tested. Values stable after 10 min observation.
Patient reported alarm sounding every 20 min. Found occlusion sensor oversensitive after firmware update 4.2.1. Adjusted threshold per manufacturer spec.
Humidifier chamber cracked — replaced unit. Noticed condensation buildup in expiratory limb. Cleared and tested. Flow readings normal.
SpO2 probe giving erratic readings on finger sensor. Cleaned contacts, replaced probe cable. Still intermittent — suspect main board connector. Escalated to biomedical engineering.
Routine PM completed. Battery replacement (was at 23% health). All self-tests passed. Calibration within spec.
Follow-up on morning O2 sensor issue. Sensor failed self-test. Replaced O2 cell module. Post-replacement: all readings nominal across FiO2 range 21-100%.
NIBP cuff not inflating. Checked tubing — found kink near connector. Replaced tubing assembly. Tested at 80/120/160 mmHg sim: all within 3mmHg tolerance.
Monthly energy delivery test. All shocks delivered within 2J of target across 50-360J range. Battery at 89% health. Pads expire 2026-04-15.
Return visit — occlusion alarm still triggering. Found IV set incompatibility with latest pump firmware. Rolled back to firmware 4.1.8. Issue resolved. Filed manufacturer report.
Biomedical engineering confirmed main board connector degraded on SpO2 channel. Board swap scheduled for tomorrow AM. Unit pulled from service and tagged out.
